title: CEC meets CJ ahead of polls, referendum schedule announcement
body: Ahead of the announcement of the schedule for the 13th national parliamentary election and the referendum, Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) AMM Nasir Uddin and the four election commissioners today met Chief Justice Syed Refaat Ahmed. The CEC and the commissioners left the Election Commission headquarters in Agargaon around 1:15pm and reached the Supreme Court premises at about 1:35pm, EC officials said. According to EC officials, issues relating to writ petitions over the delimitation of parliamentary constituencies and matters concerning symbol allocation may have been discussed. These include petitions filed by several candidates seeking to regain their candidacy following disputes over electoral symbols. The meeting comes as the EC moves closer to announcing the election and referendum schedule. The CEC is also scheduled to meet the president tomorrow, in line with customary practice ahead of poll schedule announcements. The Election Commission is preparing to hold the 13th national parliamentary election and the referendum on the same day in the first half of February. The commission has indicated it may announce the schedule on December 10 or 11. Earlier, the EC asked Bangladesh Television (BTV) and Bangladesh Betar to be ready to record the CEC's address to the nation tomorrow regarding the election and referendum schedule.
